newsitem.title: USA: W.House plan to aid D.C. to cost $339 mln in 5 yrs.
newsitem.headline: W.House plan to aid D.C. to cost $339 mln in 5 yrs.

text.p: The Clinton administration's plan to bail the District of Columbia out of its financial crisis will cost the federal government a net $339 million over five years, a White House official said.
The official said the plan, which calls for the federal government to assume responsibility for billions of dollars of city programmes, would save the city about $770 million over the same period.
In exchange for the federal aid, the District would forfeit an annual $660 million federal payment to offset revenue lost from tax-exempt federal properties, the official said.
